title: PM Modi arrives on day-long visit to Assam
content: Modi is also scheduled to witness a 40-minute aerial display by the Indian Air Force (IAF), featuring fighters, transport aircraft and helicopters

title: Water, salt and sugar packs must contain warning on presence of micro or nano plastics: Madras High Court
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy directs Union Health Ministry and FSSAI to implement their order within four weeks

title: Andhra Pradesh Budget LIVE updates: Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav to present Budget for FY2026–27
content: Agriculture Minister K. Atchannaidu is also set to present the Budget for agriculture and allied sectors on the same day

title: Missing MBA student found dead at friend's house in Indore; foul play suspected
content: While the male friend, her classmate, was untraceable, her father alleged that the man had tried to extort money from her by threatening to circulate her private photographs. The male friend is being treated as the main suspect, said police.

title: 3 militants arrested in Manipur
content: During an operation on February 13, 2026, the security personnel also recovered arms and ammunition from the Khulsaibung hill range in Tengnoupal district

title: BJP Legislator says ‘residents of Kashmir occupying land illegally in Jammu’, evokes sharp reactions
content: Randhawa said residents of Kashmir valley have encroached upon the land belonging to the Jammu Development Authority (JDA) in the city

title: Woman’s body found in box submerged in water tank in Bhopal, police begin probe
content: The body was found in a locality under the jurisdiction of Nishatpura police station in Bhopal on February 12, 2026

title: Vice-President, PM Modi pay homage to 2019 Pulwama terror attack martyrs
content: A suicide bomber crashed his explosive-laden vehicle into a bus ferrying Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel on February 14, 2019, killing 40 jawans

title: Wild elephants kill six people in Hazaribagh
content: The incident took place at around 12:30 AM in Gondwar village on Friday, around 20 km from Hazaribagh under Churchu block when the villagers were sleeping.

title: ‘Quadrupled’ seats in Parliament, will be ‘vigilant’ Opposition in Bangladesh: Ameer Shafiqur Rahman
content: The remarks of Jamaat-e-Islami leader came a day after the largest Islamist party of Bangladesh alleged that the election process had “inconsistencies and fabrications”

title: Human deaths in encounter with elephants in Odisha, a cause of concern, says WSO
content: Odisha topped human deaths in 2024-25 with 171 deaths, followed by Jharkhand (87), West Bengal (53), Assam (74) and Tamil Nadu (61), says the environmental pressure group

title: NABARD projects ₹4.88 lakh crore priority sector credit for Rajasthan
content: Chief Secretary V. Srinivas said the NABARD had carried out credit planning with the preparation of SFP for the next financial year to align financial institutions with the State’s development priorities

title: BJP hints at fielding three candidates for Rajya Sabha election from Odisha
content: BJP does not have requisite numbers in the State Assembly to ensure the election of third candidate to Upper House of Parliament

title: Major opportunities for AI in jobs and governance, says MeitY Secretary S. Krishnan
content: India is focusing on providing AI infrastructure that will spur development of applications, promoting electronics manufacturing with a thrust on semiconductors, and ensuring people secure adequate reskilling opportunities, says Secretary for the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology S. Krishnan; he adds international cooperation on AI governance is being explored and the country has potential to be a leader in offering affordable technologies

title: West Bengal elections: CPI(M) MA Baby calls for ‘secular alliance’ with Congress
content: This comes days after Congress announced that it will contest independently in all the 294 Assembly constituencies in West Bengal

title: TMC MP Abhishek meets family of Bengal migrant worker killed in Pune
content: The visit by Abhishek Banerjee to the residence of the deceased migrant worker comes a day after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee termed the killing  of Sukhen Mahato in Maharashtra a “hate crime”

title: Two arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing minor in Bhopal
content: Shahjahanabad ACP Anil Bajpai says that the alleged assault took place between May and June last year after the prime accused, Ausaf Ali Khan, befriended the girl through mutual friends

title: Battle of prowess: wrestlers to fight it out for coveted silver mace in Bihar’s Jamui
content: Crafted in 1954, the mace has become a symbol of excellence in the sport since it was presented to wrestler Vishwanath Singh in 1975 on being conferred with the ‘Bihar Kesari’ title

title: U.P. is witnessing a model of renaissance under BJP regime, says Adityanath
content: State’s nine-year journey has seen change from crime to discipline, curfew to the rule of law, riots to celebrations, says CM responding to the discussion on the Governor’s address in the Assembly

title: Arundhati Roy withdraws from Berlin Film Festival amid Gaza row
content: Her statement comes after jury president Wim Wenders’ response to a question on Gaza at a press conference, where he stated, “We cannot really enter the field of politics,” calling filmmakers “the counterweight to politics”

title: Udhayanidhi felicitates film artistes, says awards chosen by committee
content: Deputy CM counters criticism over awards; says the awards were not announced for many years together and were now being given on recommendation of a panel headed by ex-judge; A.R. Rahman, Karthi, Dhanush among artistes honoured

title: Six-year-old killed as car hits auto, pedestrians in Lucknow; accused held
content: According to the preliminary inquiry, the speeding Swift car, driven by a 21-year-old, hit an autorickshaw before ploughing into people walking along the roadside near a Hanuman temple

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin inaugurates various projects, lays foundation for multiple museums across Tamil Nadu
content: He also unveils statue of late freedom fighter Theeran Chinnamalai installed in Erode district; inaugurates memorial hall in honour of late Keelapazhuvur Chinnasamy, who sacrificed his life fighting the imposition of Hindi, in Ariyalur district

title: KSRTC operates special weekend tours to Gaganachukki, Chikka Tirupati, Melukote
content: According to officials, the services are being operated using Rajahamsa and Ashwamedha Classic buses on Saturdays and Sundays, and have been receiving a positive response from passengers.

title: Process to appoint regular Director-General of Police for Tamil Nadu resumes
content: This comes after the Supreme Court gave a week’s time to send a fresh list to the UPSC for empanelment

title: Eleven migrants workers stranded in Dubai returns to Jharkhand; three wish to stay back
content: Stranded workers sent a video to activist Sikander Ali on February 2, who shared it on social media, urging the Jharkhand government to help them return, as their passports were seized by the company

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin hands over appointment orders to 9,800 new government recruits
content: They were recruited by the Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission, the Medical Services Recruitment Board, and the Teachers Recruitment Board for various posts

title: U.S. retail chain 7-Eleven expands its only Global Solution Centre in the world in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru now represents a critical node in 7-Eleven’s global ecosystem, leveraging deep technical expertise and innovation capabilities to build end-to-end digital, data, and operational platforms

title: Graduated from IIT Madras in 2025: 22-yr-old Indian-origin student reported missing in US
content: Berkeley police are urgently seeking help to find Saketh Sreenivasaiah, a 22-year-old Indian Master's student from UC Berkeley, last seen Tuesday.  Authorities consider him an at-risk missing person.  Sreenivasaiah, who studied at IIT Madras, is described as 6'1" with short black hair and brown eyes.  Anyone with information is urged to contact law enforcement immediately.

title: ‘Lost control at 160 kmph’: How Bengaluru joyride turned fatal for six teens
content: A tragic accident occurred near Kambalipura Gate. A speeding SUV collided with a bike and then a truck. Seven lives were lost, including six students and a bike rider. The SUV was severely damaged. Another car later hit debris from the crash. The incident happened early Friday morning.

title: Watch: Hardik spotted with girlfriend; Arshdeep dances on India's arrival in Colombo
content: Team India received a colourful welcome in Colombo ahead of the T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan, with Arshdeep Singh’s dance going viral and Hardik Pandya arriving with girlfriend Mahieka Sharma. India will rely on key players like Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma and Hardik, while Varun Chakravarthy could be crucial on spin-friendly Sri Lankan pitches.

title: How Amazon shares’ longest losing streak erased $463 bn in market value
content: Amazon shares experienced their longest losing streak in nearly two decades, shedding 18% and erasing $463 billion in market value.  This downturn is largely attributed to the company's projected $200 billion capital expenditure for data centers and AI infrastructure, raising investor concerns about cash flow and cloud dominance.

title: Happy valentine's day: 51 best valentine's day wishes and messages
content: Valentine's Day 2026 is here, a perfect occasion to celebrate love in all its forms. Whether you're expressing affection to a girlfriend, boyfriend, husband, or wife, the article offers a collection of heartfelt wishes. It also acknowledges singles embracing self-love and those celebrating with friends and family, encouraging everyone to pause and connect.

title: Slain Hindu man Dipu Das’ kin votes in Bangladesh, calls for justice, accountability from new govt
content: A family in Mymensingh cast their votes hoping for justice after their son, Dipu Chandra Das, was burnt alive last December. Dipu, a garment worker, was attacked by a mob over alleged blasphemy. His father expressed hope that the newly elected government will expedite the justice process for his son.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: 'Likely caused by strangulation': Doctor who observed Epstein autopsy makes shock claim
content: Newly released Justice Department files reignite questions surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in a New York jail cell.  Despite being on suicide watch and under heightened surveillance, significant lapses in protocol occurred, including missed inmate counts and unreplaced cellmates.  The circumstances of his death remain a subject of scrutiny.

title: Chaos, courts, and kickoff: The ISL season that almost wasn’t
content: After months of administrative chaos, legal battles and uncertainty, the 2025–26 Indian Super League (ISL) season finally begins five months late. Despite disputes over league structure and governance, clubs, players and stakeholders ensured the competition survived. Yet unresolved issues, including relegation and ongoing legal challenges, mean the drama off the pitch may continue alongside the football.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Update! India, Pakistan to hold separate training sessions ahead of mega T20 WC clash
content: India and Pakistan will train at different times in Colombo before their T20 World Cup clash, with both teams also holding media interactions. Team India received a festive welcome, with Arshdeep Singh’s dance going viral. India will rely on key players like Hardik Pandya, Ishan Kishan, and Tilak Varma, while Varun Chakravarthy could be crucial on spin-friendly Sri Lankan pitches.

title: Assam visit: PM Modi to land at Dibrugarh emergency landing facility, witness aerial display
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate several key infrastructure projects in Assam, including the Emergency Landing Facility in Dibrugarh and the Kumar Bhaskar Varma Setu across the Brahmaputra River. He will also launch the temporary campus of IIM Guwahati, flag off electric buses, and inaugurate the National Data Centre for the North Eastern Region, enhancing digital infrastructure and public transport.

title: Before Pak clash, Harbhajan warns India about one player - 'Play him safely'
content: Former Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh backed India to beat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup but warned they must play spinner Usman Tariq carefully. Tariq’s bowling action has sparked controversy despite his strong T20 record. Nayan Mongia also predicted an India win, citing team confidence and Pakistan’s pressure, and backed Hardik Pandya to perform well in big matches.

title: ‘Bring back the king’: Why Nepal is calling for return of the monarchy
content: Thousands rallied for Nepal's former king, Gyanendra Shah, demanding monarchy restoration outside Kathmandu airport. Supporters chanted slogans and offered flowers, despite prohibitory orders. This resurgence follows economic distress and political instability, with pro-monarchy groups aiming to influence upcoming March elections. Many Nepalis express frustration with the republic's unfulfilled promises.

title: Shahid Kapoor's ‘O’Romeo’ opens with Rs 8.25 crore
content: ‘O’Romeo,’ starring Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri, has opened to a decent Rs 8.25 crore on its first day. The film, a dark tale of love and passion, is expected to see a surge in collections over the weekend. Its opening day occupancy reached 14.86%, with night shows recording the highest footfall.

title: ‘Come identify your child’: Secret dawn drive turns fatal for six boys in Bengaluru
content: Six Bengaluru boys met a tragic end in a pre-dawn car crash, leaving grieving families in shock. Parents, believing their sons were studying, were unaware of a secret late-night outing. The devastating news arrived via police calls, shattering their trust and revealing a joyride that ended in tragedy.

title: IndiGo plans to hire over 1,000 pilots after December's crew crunch
content: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is hiring over 1,000 pilots to address operational disruptions caused by pilot shortages. The recruitment drive follows a December incident where over 5,000 flights were cancelled. The airline is also adjusting network planning and increasing standby crew to manage its rapid fleet expansion.

title: Bangladesh polls: After Hasina, Delhi gears up for new regime in Dhaka
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated BNP chief Tarique Rahman on his party's election victory, signaling a shift in New Delhi's approach. While endorsing the poll process, India faces new security concerns with the rise of Jamaat-e-Islami. New Delhi aims to strengthen bilateral ties, focusing on peace, progress, and shared development goals.

title: Woman’s body found in trunk in Bhopal water tank; live-in partner, mother and siblings held
content: In a shocking incident, Bhopal police have arrested a live-in partner and three family members after a woman's decomposed body was discovered in a trunk within a water tank. The accused allegedly murdered the woman, concealed the body at their residence for a day, and then attempted to dispose of it.

title: Hardik Pandya's dressing-room advice that revived Ishan Kishan's career
content: Following his match-winning knock against Namibia, Ishan Kishan revealed Hardik Pandya's advice to focus on domestic cricket after losing his BCCI contract. Pandya urged Kishan to let his bat do the talking, a sentiment echoed by Pandya's own experience with fan backlash.

title: Patrick Mahomes and Brittany Mahomes make $1M move before season
content: Patrick Mahomes, the Kansas City Chiefs’ star player, is fully focused on recovering from his brutal injuries, after recording a pretty tough time on the field in the last season. As he focuses on his recovery, Patrick Mahomes and his wife, Brittany Mahomes, just pulled off a million dollar move, away from the world of NFL, which has now broken records.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: 'Absolutely vile': Candace Owens accuses Erika Kirk of having strange relationship with a 15-year-old girl
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens’ use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: DAC allows acquisition of Rafale's SCALP, Russian S400 missiles used in Operation Sindoor
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the purchase of SCALP missiles for Rafale jets and more missiles for the S400 aerial shield system. This move enhances India's defence capabilities. The deal for 114 Rafale jets will see them manufactured outside France, with deliveries starting in 2028.

title: Chakravarthy vs Usman Tariq? Spin to play major role in India-Pakistan clash
content: Spinners are set to dominate the India-Pakistan clash at the R Premadasa Stadium, with Zimbabwe's recent success highlighting the pitch's nature. India's Varun Chakravarthy, known for his precise lengths and pace, and Pakistan's Abrar Ahmed and Usman Tariq, with their unique variations, are poised to be key figures. Their ability to exploit the conditions could significantly impact the high-stakes encounter.

title: T20 World Cup: England, SA, NZ and more; full match schedule for February 14
content: The T20 World Cup heats up with Zimbabwe stunning Australia and UAE edging Canada. USA secured a dominant win. February 14 features crucial clashes: New Zealand vs. South Africa, Oman vs. Ireland, and England vs. Scotland, with several teams vying for Super Eight berths and others fighting for survival.

title: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi switches pitches: 175 in U-19 World Cup final, now class 10 boards
content: Following a stellar ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 victory, Vaibhav Sooryavanshi is now preparing for his Class 10 board examinations. The 14-year-old batting sensation, who set multiple records during the tournament, will sit for his exams at Podar International School, where he will receive no special treatment.

title: 'Akshaye Khanna had little to say, but was very cooperative,’ Neeta Lulla says
content: Akshaye Khanna has long maintained an air of mystique around him. Known for avoiding parties, interviews and unnecessary public appearances, the actor has consistently chosen to live life on his own terms. Colleagues often describe him as serious, deeply passionate about his craft and largely unaffected by public opinion or industry pressures.

title: Watch: Bajrang Dal vandalises Narsee Monjee College during Valentine’s event
content: At Narsee Monjee College in Indore, a joyful Valentine’s Day gathering took a dark turn as activists from Bajrang Dal stormed the event, causing chaos and destruction. Thankfully, police were quick to respond, ensuring the safety of students and escorting them back to their homes.

title: CM Omar gets rare praise from BJP MLAs for Amarnath Yatra fund allocation
content: BJP MLAs lauded Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's Rs 180 crore budget for the Amarnath Yatra, seeing it as a positive sign of Kashmir joining the national mainstream. Despite party criticism on other issues, legislators acknowledged this constructive decision, highlighting a perceived shift in the CM's stance on the pilgrimage, a move they felt deserved appreciation.

title: Sturla Holm Lægreid wins second bronze at 2026 Winter Olympics
content: Sturla Holm Lægreid won his second bronze medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics, finishing third in the men’s 10km sprint biathlon in Milan. The result came days after his public confession about being unfaithful to his girlfriend. While personal controversy followed him, he said focusing on skiing and shooting helped him stay calm and perform strongly on the Olympic stage.

title: Gayle-like impact? Ex-cricketer sees Abhishek Sharma as India’s T20 engine
content: "India's success in the last one year, (has) mainly depended on Abhishek Sharma, the star because the way he batted the past year, I think that's phenomenal."

title: Legacy issues cast shadow on Hyderabad Metro Rail phase II plans
content: State government has been seeking Centre’s nod for a Joint Venture for Phase II works and takeover of the Phase I from L&T. Outstanding debt, the Old City corridor, and withheld Viability Gap Funding may complicate Detailed Project Report clearance and financial settlement amid scrutiny and negotiations

title: British dentist’s emotional reunion with great‑grandfather’s grave ending family’s 119-year search
content: Decades-long family quest culminated in Secunderabad, where history, memory, and emotion converged at a Commonwealth War Graves cemetery, where Robin Dickson honoured his great-grandfather — Lieutenant Charles Wilson — closing a circle left incomplete for over a century

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of  ‘politically uncivilised behaviour’
content: Party says he created anarchy and disorder in Parliament; also seeks the Congress leader’s response on govt. notification on the  singing of Vande Mataram in full

title: NLCIL secures NABL accreditation
content: The NLCIL said the accreditation enhances the company’s capability to support its mining, thermal power, and renewable energy operations through reliable in-house testing and R&D excellence

title: Another 6 lakh names may go from Bengal voter list
content: These voters did not appear for the hearings under the SIR of electoral rolls despite notices being issued to them, say State Election Commission officials; 58 lakh names have already been deleted

title: Hasina’s presence in India, Ganga waters treaty to be key priorities for BNP government: sources
content: Sources in the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) say India and Bangladesh have a settled border and ‘it makes no sense to shoot to kill someone’; besides, they add that former PM Sheikh Hasina’s comments on Bangladesh’s internal affairs will pose a challenge to normalisation of ties

title: Fourth consecutive win for Congress since 2023
content: The latest victory in the municipal polls adds to Congress’ success in the Assembly, Parliament and Panchayat elections, apart from two bypoll wins in constituencies vacated, following the untimely demise of sitting BRS MLAs

title: Congress, Trinamool congratulate BNP for winning parliamentary elections in Bangladesh
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee extend greetings to the victorious BNP a day after voting had ended in the neighbouring country

title: Chennithala serves privilege notice against Vasavan
content: The notice was served over “contradictory and unrealistic replies” in the Assembly regarding the amount spent by the Travancore Devaswom Board for the Global Ayyappa Sangam

title: Sikh separatist Pannun murder plot: Nikhil Gupta pleads guilty in U.S. court
content: Gupta has been jailed in Brooklyn since his ‌June 2024 extradition to the U.S. from the Czech Republic, where he had been arrested ⁠a year earlier. He had pleaded not guilty previously

title: IAF, Royal Thai Air Force jointly conduct air combat exercise in Indian Ocean Region
content: IAF assets operated from airbases in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, demonstrating strategic reach into the IOR, while the Thai Gripen fighters were launched from bases in Thailand

title: Give ‘some acknowledgement’ to Dhrupad singer, Supreme Court asks A.R. Rahman
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi was hearing a plea by Mr. Wasifuddin Dagar against the September 2025 Delhi High Court order, which had held there was no prima facie evidence of the Junior Dagar Brothers being the authors of a classical rendition of “Shiv Stuti”.

title: Union Home Ministry plans English medical dictionary that will be translated into Indian languages
content: Invites bids from publishers to compile a standard English medical dictionary that can be translated into 15 Indian languages

title: Relocating racing tracks from BTC to Kunigal will be time and cost intensive
content: The century-old club has estimated that a new 2,200 m-2,400 m track laying, matching up to international standards, could cost upto ₹600 crore

title: India believed that Panchsheel pact settled border: CDS Anil Chauhan
content: Gen. Chauhan underlines the increasing strategic importance of the Himalayan frontiers, highlights the government’s efforts on infrastructure development in such border areas

title: Telecom service providers do not own spectrum: Supreme Court
content: The Bench of Justices P.S. Narasimha and Atul Chandurkar says spectrum is a scarce natural resource owned by the people of India, with legal title vesting exclusively in the Union of India, which holds it in trust for the public

title: Sewage pollution: PCB awaits court directive before initiating further steps
content: The Kerala State Pollution Control Board had earlier sent notices to 71 apartment complexes and commercial units located close to the Thevara-Perandoor and Edappally canals for not having STPs

title: A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan advocates for apolitical temple trust boards
content: A 22-km Giri Pradakshina route, developed with an approximate cost of ₹10 crore, around Srikalahasti temple inaugurated

title: DGCA slaps ₹1 crore fine on Air India for operating plane without requisite certification
content: On November 26, 2025, the airline informed the DGCA about the flying of the A320 aircraft with the expired airworthiness review certificate (ARC) on eight revenue sectors

title: BRS performance in municipal polls is highly encouraging: KTR
content: BRS working president: Despite misuse of power by the ruling party on a large-scale, people supported us

title: A.P. treasury benches unhappy with reply of Revenue Minister on grievance redressal
content: Closing petitions submitted by the people is not a solution, say TDP MLAs, adding that rendering justice is also necessary

title: KIIFB in-principle nod for MC Road and Sabari Rail projects
content: A board meeting gives approval for providing funding to the tune of ₹5,217 crore for the four-laning of the Kesavadasapuram-Angamaly MC Road, ₹1,900 crore for the Angamaly-Erumely Sabari Rail project and ₹600 crore for the Aerospace Control Systems Complex proposed under KSpace among other key infra projects

title: How can Ambati Rambabu’s ‘derogatory remarks’ against Chief Minister’s mother be taken lightly, asks Lokesh
content: The HRD Minister asserts that the coalition government does not engage in vendetta politics, but it will take strict action against anyone who speaks disrespectfully about women

title: Title deeds to be distributed to over 1 lakh families at Haveri on Saturday
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will inaugurate the programme, while Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar will distribute the title deeds

title: Slam dunks, global games, emerging stars: What to watch on All-Star Weekend
content: Our experts break down what to watch over the 2026 NBA All-Star Weekend and their picks for contests, competitions and more.

title: 'I blew it': Malinin falls twice in Olympic shocker
content: American sensation "Quad God" Ilia Malinin fell twice in a disastrous free skate Friday night, allowing Kazakhstan's Mikhail Shaidorov to claim a stunning gold medal.

title: Wroblewski calls out officiating after chippy U.S. win
content: Abbey Murphy was once again in the middle of the action, drawing and taking penalties as the U.S. women's hockey team cruised to a 6-0 win over Italy that got "a little spicy" and led to coach John Wroblewski sounding off on Olympic officiating.

title: 76ers' Edgecombe named MVP in Rising Stars win
content: Philadelphia rookie VJ Edgecombe led Team Vince to victory in the Rising Stars event at NBA All-Star Weekend on Friday night.

title: Baylor 1B's 3-grand slam game ties NCAA record
content: Tyce Armstrong made history in his Baylor debut by hitting three grand slams in a 15-2 win over New Mexico State on Friday night. He became only the second college player to pull off that feat.

title: WR Kingston no longer at BYU after rape charge
content: Brigham Young University says its standout wide receiver Parker Kingston is no longer a student there after he was arrested this week on a first-degree felony rape charge.

title: Source: D-backs keeping Gallen on 1-year deal
content: Zac Gallen is staying with the Diamondbacks after agreeing to a one-year deal worth $22.05 million, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ohtani's focus on 'being healthy,' shot at Cy Young
content: Shohei Ohtani's 27-pitch mound session at the Dodgers' sprawling complex Friday morning marked the start of spring training and, more notably, of his return to a full-time two-way role.

title: Wrexham into FA Cup last 16 for 1st time since '97
content: Wrexham achieved another landmark moment in their meteoric rise after reaching the last 16 of England's FA Cup for the first time since 1997.

title: 🏆 Lapsed fan's guide to fantasy baseball
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: USA men's hockey back in action and more from Milan Cortina
content: Saturday at the Winter Olympics includes Team USA men's hockey looking to win against Denmark and USA curling round-robins.

title: Inside the controversy around the French ice dance team's Olympic gold
content: The French team's victory in ice dance has drawn criticism for a number of reasons. We break it down.

content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

content: Jumping over cars -- and Shaq -- wins fans but doesn't translate into the talents recruiters want to see

title: Men's Bracketology: Don't sleep on this year's bubble
content: The Last Four In and First Four Out groupings feature teams with big wins -- and high potential for March.

title: Watch guide: UConn-Georgetown, Arizona-Texas Tech carry big stakes
content: With projected 1-seeds in high-profile games, the door is open for movement at the top of the bracket.

title: Chelsea coach Rosenior shows ruthless side in homecoming at Hull to prove credentials
content: Hull City is where Liam Rosenior got his start, but he didn't let up as Chelsea demolished his former club in the FA Cup.

title: Wetzel: A coach's lessons on fatherhood ... from 1948
content: Joe Judge was trying to make a point to help a player get a court injunction. Instead he got a viral moment.

title: Answering key offseason questions for every NFL team: Intel on free agency, QB decisions and draft options
content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

title: 2026 Daytona 500 preview: Your cheat sheet to the Great American Race
content: Impress your friends by repeating ESPN's easy-to-learn fun facts about the Great American Race ahead of this year's edition of the Daytona 500.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts, earned the pole Wednesday with a lap at 183.925 mph.

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract might have been the final blow for labor peace
content: MLB fans are angry -- and players and owners are, too. What did this offseason mean for baseball's coming labor strife?

title: Inside Macklin Celebrini's rise to stardom for the Sharks, Team Canada
content: Scoring the opening Olympic goal for his country was the latest milestone on the phenom's meteoric rise.

title: Women's Bracketology: There's a new No. 1 seed
content: For the first time this season, there's a shake-up on the top line. Vanderbilt beat Texas to unseat the Longhorns.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Reranking 2023's college football recruiting classes
content: With the benefit of hindsight, we can better judge how a class contributed. Here's how 2023 panned out.

title: NFL draft prospects with a true Round 1 grade: 11 players who are clear first-rounders
content: We'll see 32 picks in Round 1, but which prospects have actually earned a first-round grade? There are currently 11 in the 2026 class. Here's the updated list.

title: Premier League superlatives: The 25 best and worst players at different skills
content: Who's the Premier League's fastest player? The slowest? Best passer? The worst? And more. Here are 25 superlatives from different skills.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea, Man United eye UCL standout Stankovic
content: Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester United are all monitoring Club Brugge midfielder Aleksandar Stankovic. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 70% Bangladeshis Voted 'Yes' To July Charter. What Does It Mean?
content: There was also the national referendum on the implementation of a reform package, which saw a 60.26 per cent voter turnout in Bangladesh, with the 'yes' vote winning a clear majority, the Election Commission announced Friday.

title: Indian Student Missing In California, Search Enters 5th Day
content: An Indian student has been reported missing in California, prompting a citywide search that has entered its fourth day on Saturday.

title: BJP Makes Its Mark In Bangladesh Elections, Wins 1 Seat
content: In Bangladesh's 13th General Elections, the Bangladesh Jatiya Party (BJP) secured a single seat, with Andaleeve Rahman Partho winning from the Bhola-1 constituency.

title: Rahul Gandhi Meets Farmers On India-US Deal. "Stage-Managed," Says BJP
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi met farmers at his parliament office and listened to their concerns over the India and US framework trade deal. Taking note of the meeting, the BJP called the meeting "stage-managed", "artificial" and "baseless".

title: 2 Anti-India Terror Accused Among 3 Ex-Convicts Who Won Bangladesh Polls
content: Three Bangladeshi leaders have suddenly found themselves to be very lucky. Two of them are from Tarique Rahman's Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), which won the first national election since the fall of former prime minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Supreme Court Asks Himachal Pradesh To Hold Local Body Polls By May 31
content: In a significant relief to the Himachal Pradesh government, the Supreme Court on Friday extended from April 30 to May 31 the deadline fixed by the high court for holding polls for local bodies in the state.

title: Who Is Nikhil Gupta, Indian Man Who Plotted Khalistani Terrorist's Murder
content: In a major case announced by US authorities, 54-year-old Nikhil Gupta, an Indian national, has pleaded guilty to plotting the murder of a US citizen in New York City.

title: "Next Stop Hyderabad': Bandi Sanjay Kumar Praises BJP's Karimnagar Civic Win
content: Karimnagar MP and Union Minister Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Friday praised the BJP's victory in the Karimnagar Municipal Corporation elections as "historic", declaring that the party will next target Hyderabad.

title: Indian Man Pleads Guilty To Murder-For-Hire Plot Against Khalistani Terrorist
content: An Indian national has pleaded guilty in the United States to orchestrating a murder-for-hire plot aimed at assassinating a US citizen and Khalistani Terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun in New York City

title: Aviation Watchdog Puts Stricter Breath Analyser Test Norms In Place For Pilots
content: Aviation safety regulator DGCA has put in place stricter breath analyser test requirements for pilots, wherein those found repeatedly violating the norms could even face cancellation of their pilot license, according to a source.

title: Expelled Over Teachers' Meme, Court Allows Student To Take Class 10 Exam
content: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed a minor boy, rusticated from a school in Indore for allegedly circulating an objectionable meme concerning teachers, to appear in the Class 10 examination.

title: Video: US Military's Lethal Kinetic Strike On Narco Boat In The Caribbean
content: The US military said Friday that it has carried out another deadly strike on a vessel accused of trafficking drugs in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Who Is Kim Ju Ae, North Korean Leader's Daughter Set To Become His Successor
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un may choose his daughter Kim Ju Ae as his successor, South Korean lawmakers revealed, citing a spy agency briefing.

title: Indore Water Tragedy: A Family Mourns Death Of Girl, 2, After Many Prayers
content: "How can we forget the moments we spent with our child?" asks the grieving father of two-year-old Siya Prajapati, one of the youngest patients to die during the vomiting and diarrhea outbreak caused by contaminated drinking water in Indore.

title: US Sending Second Aircraft Carrier To Middle East Amid Iran Tensions
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he decided to move a second aircraft carrier into the Middle East as he presses Iran to make a deal over its nuclear program.

title: Trump Threatens To Order Election Reforms Ahead Of Midterms
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday threatened to try to bypass Congress and force new voting laws ahead of the November midterm elections, where his Republican Party fears losing control of the legislature.

title: "Problematic": Lawyer Urges Families Not To Sign Air India's Settlement Terms
content: Attorney Chuck N. Chionuma, representing the families of over 105 victims of the Air India Flight AI-171 crash, advised not to sign the proposed settlement terms offered by the airline.

title: US Envoy To NATO Says Russia May Never Be Ready For Peace Deal
content: Washington's representative to NATO said Friday that Russia may never be ready to make a deal to end the war in Ukraine, which Moscow's forces launched nearly four years ago.

title: Trump Says Regime Change In Iran "Would Be Best Thing That Could Happen"
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that a change in power in Iran "would be the best thing that could happen" as the US administration weighs whether to take military action against Tehran.

title: If Ukraine War Ends, EU Will Need "Rules Of Coexistence" With Russia: Macron
content: French President Emmanuel Macron said Friday that once the conflict in Ukraine is settled, Europe will need to establish a new framework for living alongside Russia to prevent any future military escalation.

title: Pannun murder plot: US govt wants 21-24 yrs for Gupta, but sentencing at judge’s discretion
content: the plea marks a striking turnaround from Nikhil Gupta's previous stance . since his extradition from Czech Republic in June 2024, he had denied wrongdoing . legal analysts suggest his decision to plead guilty stems from overwhelming evidence amassed by federal prosecutors .

content: heir has accu-sed junior dagar Bandhu of copyright infringement . 'Shiva Stuti' was originally composed by Ustad Faiyazuddin Dagar and his brother Zahiruddin .

title: Married man in SC over dowry complaint by 'live-in partner'
content: can a married man in a live-in relationship be prosecuted for dowry harassment on the complaint of a woman with whom he was in an extra-marital affair? the law specifies that only a wife can make such a complaint against her husband and his relatives? a doctor challenged a HC order rejecting his plea for quashing prosecution against him .

title: India will be the engine to drive world growth: PM Modi
content: the pm said few countries were willing to sign FTAs during the UPA dispensation when India was marred by scams and counted among 'Fragile Five' economies . the govt has signed agreements covering 38 countries .

title: Telangana local poll results: Congress sweeps 83 municipalities; BJP leads in two cities
content: Having 30 years of experience, Roushan Ali is covering the govt, chief minister's office and politics as a senior assistant editor of The Times of India. During the three decades of journalism career he had initially covered important citizen-centric and infrastructure beats like urban development, water and electricity supply, traffic and transport, cantonment, education, welfare and rural development. title: As New Delhi turns 95, PMO shifts to Seva Teerth: City's layered past shapes its legacy
content: new Delhi turned 95 today, a milestone that binds two moments of power separated by nearly a century . in 1931, the British formally inaugurated New Delhi as the imperial capital . ninety-five years later, prime minister Narendra Modi marked a symbolic departure from that legacy by shifting the Prime Minister’s Office from South Block to 'Seva Teerth'

title: College baseball 2026: Top storylines, POY picks and MCWS predictions
content: our college baseball experts break it all down, plus give some way-too-early predictions for the end of the year . we've got a slew of new head coaches at top programs looking to make their marks early on, like Josh Elander at Tennessee and Chris Pollard at Virginia .

title: Must let elected govts function, SC advises HCs; frowns on Himachal court’s repeated interference
content: a bench of chief justice Surya Kant and justice Joymalya Bagchi said the high court was not allowing the elected govt to function . the bench said the HC had rightly rejected the reliance on the ongoing delimitation process to seek postponement of local body elections by six months .

title: What the soccer world can learn from FA Cup heroes Macclesfield
content: macclesfield beat crystal palace in the 3rd round of the FA Cup . it was 117 places between the two sides in the English soccer pyramid . there were never before during 154 years of the tournament, just like March Madness .

title: Inspired by Stephen Curry, 'GOAT' aims to be the ultimate underdog story
content: director Tyree Dillihay started working on the newest basketball animated film "GOAT" the project is executive-produced by Golden State Warriors star Stephen Curry . the movie follows the journey of a young goat, Will -- played by actor Caleb McLaughlin -- who has a dream of playing "roarball"

title: 8.6k complaints received against sitting judges in last 10 years: Govt
content: all 8,630 complaints against judges of the supreme court and high courts have been received between 2016 and 2025 . the frequency of the complaints has increased in recent times with 50% of all such grievances received in the last four years . chief justices of high courts are competent to receive complaints against the conduct of high court judges .

title: BNP chief Tarique Rahman emerges as new face of Bangladesh
content: the 60-year-old left the country in 2008 saying he needed medical treatment after his release from detention under a military-backed caretaker regime . he returned home to a hero’s welcome last Christmas after sheikh hasina’s ouster in 2024 .

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026
content: the Longhorns finished 10-3 last season and missed the college football Playoff . the 2026 Way-Too-Early All-America team is a tough position to pick just one player . quarterback arch Manning, receiver Cam Coleman and linebackers Colin Simmons and Rasheem Biles are on the team .

title: NBA All-Star 2026: Team Vince defeats Team Melo to win Rising Stars championship game
content: this year marks the 75th annual NBA All-Star Game . two teams of U.S. players will face one world team in a round-robin tournament with four 12-minute games . the loser of Game 1 will face Team C in the penultimate game .

title: Offseason grades for every big move
